info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 5:50PM CDT until June 30 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
FFWSGF
The National Weather Service in Springfield has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Ozark County in southwestern Missouri...
* Until midnight CDT tonight.
* At 550 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Gainesville, Bakersfield, Theodosia, Pontiac, Wasola, Sundown, Willhoit, Hardenville, Brixey, Zanoni, Rockbridge, Noble, Tecumseh, Sycamore, Isabella, Udall, Thornfield, Dora, Long Run, Norfork Lake and Bull Shoals Lake.
This includes the following low water crossings... Pond Fork at County Road 883, Little North Fork at Haskins Ford Road, Spring Creek at County Road 142, Possum Walk Creek at Highway T, Little North Fork River at County Road 916, Spring Creek at County Road 349 and Lick Creek at County Road 528.
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
